intro: Cephalocereus purpusii, commonly known as the Mexican moon cactus, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its bright orange or red flowering stems, which are actually a grafted variety of the genus Hatiora. The plant has a short, thick stem with a dense covering of spines, and its flowers bloom at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators. It is a popular ornamental plant due to its vibrant colors and unique appearance. The plant requires well-draining soil and minimal water to thrive.
